onThisDay.event: King Henry VIII dies at Whitehall Palace. Shakespeare would later immortalize him in 'Henry VIII' (1613).
Sir Francis Drake dies at sea. His privateering adventures influenced Shakespeare's maritime imagery.
William Shakespeare born in Stratford-upon-Avon (traditional date).
William Shakespeare dies in Stratford-upon-Avon, aged 52.
The Globe Theatre burns down during a performance of Henry VIII when a cannon misfires.
The Globe Theatre likely opens with a performance of Julius Caesar.
Shakespeare's 'Othello' is performed at Whitehall Palace for King James I.
Shakespeare's twins Hamnet and Judith are baptized in Stratford.
Shakespeare's only son Hamnet dies at age 11, possibly inspiring the melancholy of later plays.
The Lord Chamberlain's Men become the King's Men under James I's patronage.
King Lear is performed before King James I at Whitehall.
Laurence Olivier makes his Old Vic debut as Hamlet, launching his legendary career.
Richard Burton opens as Hamlet at the Old Vic to acclaim.
The National Theatre's production of Othello with Olivier opens to controversy and acclaim.
Kenneth Branagh's Renaissance Theatre Company performs Hamlet in London.
The start of Shakespeare's most prolific period - Hamlet, Othello, King Lear, and Macbeth would all be written in the next six years.
Elizabeth I is crowned Queen of England. Her 45-year reign would see the flowering of English drama.
Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet is likely first performed around this Valentine's Day period.
Queen Elizabeth I dies. James VI of Scotland becomes James I of England.
Shakespeare's Globe Theatre reopens on Bankside, reconstructed near the original site.
The Theatre in Shoreditch is dismantled; its timbers would be used to build The Globe.
The Battle of Agincourt is fought - immortalized in Shakespeare's Henry V.
The Gunpowder Plot is discovered. Its aftermath may have influenced Macbeth.
The Tempest is likely performed for the first time at the Blackfriars Theatre.
Twelfth Night is performed at Middle Temple Hall for the Twelfth Night celebration.
Laurence Olivier is born in Dorking, Surrey.
Dame Judi Dench is born in York.
Sir Ian McKellen is born in Burnley, Lancashire.
Kenneth Branagh is born in Belfast.
David Tennant is born in Bathgate, Scotland.
